search_results.title: Perfect game (bowling) - Wikipedia

search_results.snippet: In bowling games that use 10 pins, such as ten-pin bowling, candlepin bowling, and duckpin bowling, the highest possible score is 300, achieved by bowling 12 strikes in a row in a single game: one strike in each of the first nine frames, and three more in the tenth frame.
search_results.title: Perfect game (bowling) - Wikipedia

search_results.snippet: The maximum score in ten-pin bowling is 300. This consists of getting 12 strikes in a row in one game (one strike each in frames 19, and all three possible strikes in the tenth frame), and is also known as a perfect game.
